p: California and central Chile are two distant geographic areas with very similar Mediterranean climates, topography and vegetation types [20], [21]. These features have stimulated comparative studies which have demonstrated that, despite their similarities, each geographic area has distinctive native and exotic flora [22], [23] differing fire regimes [21], [24], different soil nutrient content [25], and different anthropogenic and economic activities [23]. Overall, these quite distinctive floras have undergone convergent evolution, expressed in similar native vegetation structure and the functional traits of native plants [24], [26], [27].
